clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization of the Iatrogenic Drug Risk in Elderly Patients With Chronic Pain Who Consult the Pain Assessment and Treatment Centre at the Nimes University Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Characterization of the Iatrogenic Drug Risk in Elderly Patients With Chronic Pain Who Consult the Pain Assessment and Treatment Centre at the Nimes University Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
Chronic pain may be an additional risk factor for drug iatrogeny due to its management and also drug non-compliance in the geriatric population.
it seems interesting to carry out an inventory of the iatrogenic risk before and after the consultation at the pain centre to enable us to identify the patients most at risk. This study would make it possible to characterize elderly patients with chronic pain, in order to consider, in a future study, setting up a pharmaceutical consultation.

primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of the ADE Geriatric risk score
primary_outcome.description: The score is calculated on 10 points based on 3 criteria : number of drugs prescribed, prescription of neuroleptics and the initiation of an anticoagulant prescription less than 3 months old. It classifies patients into 3 risk categories: a low risk level for a score of 0 to 1 point, a medium risk level for a score of 2 to 5 points and a high risk level for a score of 6 to 10 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of patients with a low, medium or high risk level calculated by ADE Geriatric risk score according to the type of pain
secondary_outcome.description: The score is calculated on 10 points based on 3 criteria : number of drugs prescribed, prescription of neuroleptics and the initiation of an anticoagulant prescription less than 3 months old. It classifies patients into 3 risk categories: a low risk level for a score of 0 to 1 point, a medium risk level for a score of 2 to 5 points and a high risk level for a score of 6 to 10 points.

study_pop.textblock: patients aged at least 65 years consulting at the pain centre of the Nîmes University Hospital for chronic pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient must be affiliated or beneficiary of a health insurance
- Patient ≥ 65 years old
- Having an outpatient consultation at the pain centre of the Nîmes University hospital of for chronic pain
- Available for pharmaceutical consultation about 30 minutes
Exclusion Criteria:
- It is impossible to give information
- The patient objects to participating in this study
